Biography of Sheikh Muhammad al-Bashar

Name and Lineage: He is Sheikh Muhammad bin Hasan bin Ali bin Salim al-Bashar al-Rashidi. 'Rashid' is an Egyptian coastal city located in the north of Egypt at the western branch of the Nile. He was a Maliki jurist, and his father was among the scholars.

His Works: He authored the book (Ash-hal al-Masalik fi Madhhab al-Imam Malik), which is a poetic versification of the text (Targhib al-Murid al-Salik ila Madhhab al-Imam Malik) by Sheikh Ibrahim al-Suha'i al-Azhari (d. 1080 AH). In his poem, he followed the prevalent (Mashhur) rulings of the school of Imam Malik. This poem was explained by Uthman bin Hasanain Barri al-Ja'ali in the book: (Siraj al-Salik Sharh Ash-hal al-Masalik).

His Death: The exact year of his death is not known, but he was alive in the year 1161 AH. May Allah have mercy on him and grant him residence in His vast gardens.

In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful

Introduction
1 - Praise be to Allah, Who has obligated ... Upon creation His Oneness, and urged
2 - His servants to comply with His command ... And singled out those He desired for success
3 - Then blessings and peace consecutively ... Upon a Prophet who came to us with glad tidings
4 - Muhammad, the best Prophet sent ... To the worlds as a mercy and favor
5 - And the Family, the Companions, and followers of guidance ... By the count of my Lord's knowledge, forever
6 - (And hereafter): Indeed, knowledge is a binding duty ... Upon every responsible person to know
7 - What Allah has made obligatory of rulings ... Upon him within the laws of Islam
8 - And indeed the best thing a youth cares for and strives ... For, is that which contains benefit for mankind
9 - And I have seen a comprehensive summary ... Polished, made easy for the beginner
10 - By the virtuous Al-Suha'i Ibrahim ... May his Master grant him lasting satisfaction
11 - It is called: 'Targhib al-Murid al-Salik' ... In the school of the Scholar, Imam Malik
12 - So I desired it as a poem, hoping it would result ... In benefit for the beginner and be easy to memorize
13 - And perhaps I advanced or delayed [sections] ... Or added rulings by which I completed it
14 - I named it: 'Ash-hal al-Masalik' (The Easiest Paths) ... For the versification of 'Targhib al-Murid al-Salik'
15 - And I ask Allah by the rank of Ahmad ... And his noble Family for the attainment of my goal
16 - And that it be purely for His Essence ... And a cause for triumph along with His pleasure

Chapter: Principles of Religion and What is Obligatory upon the Responsible Person
19 - The first duty upon the responsible person: ... Is knowing Allah with certainty, so know [Him]
20 - And indeed the entire world is created (temporal) ... And Allah is Existent, Pre-eternal, the Inheritor
21 - And Self-Subsisting, Possessor of richness ... Different from His creation; to Him belongs all Praise
22 - And One in His Essence and in Attributes ... 'There is nothing like Allah', so know Him
23 - He has: Speech, Power, Hearing, Sight ... Will, Knowledge, Life; the report has come
24 - And His being Living, Willing, Powerful ... And Speaking, Hearing, Seeing
25 - And Knowing; Exalted is He above representation ... And nature, and causation, and negation [of attributes]
26 - And color, and taste, and body, or accident ... And matters are not imposed upon Allah as duties
27 - And everything that comes with a wording that implies [anthropomorphism] ... Interpret it, or say regarding it: 'My Lord knows best'
28 - And Destiny - know - its good and its bad ... Is by His command, its sweet and its bitter
29 - What He wills exists, otherwise it would not be ... When He decrees a matter, He says: 'Be', and it is
30 - And He forgives sin other than Shirk (polytheism) for whom ... He wills; and Repentance is obligatory, so adhere to it
31 - And its condition: is that one desists from his sin ... Immediately, and the resolve not to return
32 - And returning possible injustices, and remorse ... And by avoiding major sin, minor sins are erased
33 - And whoever dies and did not repent from his burden ... Entrust all his affair to Allah

44 - And by the Banner, and the Pond (Hawd), and the Station (Wasilah) ... And by Intercessions and virtue
45 - And everything that has come to us from the Prophet ... Regarding an angel, or prophets, or books

47 - And from it are the signs of the coming of the Hour ... Like the [rising of] sun, and the Mahdi, and the Jassasah (Spy)

Chapter: Types of Water and What Removes Impurity
72 - And every water descending from the sky ... Or springing from earth, or flowing, increasing
73 - Remaining on its attributes or changed ... By its earth or what has flowed over it

Chapter: Pure and Impure Substances and Permissible Adornment
79 - And every living thing is pure, and attached to it are: ... Its saliva, its mucus, and its sweat
80 - Its bile, its phlegm, its tears ... The gallbladder of the permissible [animal] or its dung

Chapter: Removal of Impurity and What is Excused of It
104 - Is removing impurity a Sunnah ... Or obligatory with remembering it and the ability
105 - In the ample time, from the praying person ... And the garment or what he touched of the place? ...
106 - Its falling upon the praying person invalidates [prayer] ... Like remembering it during prayer, they established
107 - Regarding its smell or its color if it is difficult ... Is a pardon; and what is in its taste, pardon is [not] seen
108 - And everything that is difficult, then it is excused ... Due to its hardship, and the Religion is ease and kindness
109 - Like: the garment of a butcher and the garment of the nursing mother ... And the wetness of hemorrhoids or what resembles it
110 - And likewise: mud of the splash and rain ... Or incontinence that is constant, or like the trace
111 - Of a boil that was not picked, or a fly ... If it flew from filth onto the clothes
112 - Or the dropping of a flea, and less than a Dirham [size] ... Of the eye of pus or purulence or blood
113 - Or what is on the passerby of what flowed [in streets] ... And the Muslim is believed in what he said

Chapter: Obligations of Wudu, Its Sunan and Virtues
114 - (Obligations of Wudu) are seven, count them: ... Intention, and washing the face after it
115 - And your washing the hands to the elbows ... And wiping all the head to the partings
116 - And washing your feet with your ankles is established ... And Continuity (Fawr), and Rubbing (Dalk) with remembrance if able
117 - And say eight is the number of the (Sunan): ... Start washing your hands to the wrists
118 - Rinse the mouth, and inhale water into nose, and blow it out ... And return the wipe of the head from the back
119 - And wiping the sides of both ears, assume it ... Renew the water for them, and order its obligation

120 - As for its (Virtues), ten are mentioned: ... Using Siwak, then the pure place
121 - And washing twice and thrice in what is washed ... And the water with perfection like Ghusl, minimize it
122 - And for the vessel and the limb, the right side; and the Sunan ... In themselves or with obligations, arrange them
123 - And starting with the head from the front ... Saying Bismillah like Ghusl and Tayammum
124 - And closing [doors], and extinguishing, and entering ... And dressing, and the opposite, and like eating
125 - Burial, and closing eyes, ascending the pulpit ... Intercourse, riding, hunting; slaughter and sacrifice

Chapter: Nullifiers of Wudu
126 - It is nullified by: Apostasy, or doubt [if] occurred ... In purity or nullification and precedence, and the Event (Hadath)
127 - Urine, and wind, stool with Wady ... And wash the entire private part intending [purification] for Madhy
128 - Its causes: Loss of reason either ... By insanity, or by intoxication, or by fainting
129 - Sleep, long or short if heavy ... Not light with shortness; and recommended [wudu] if it is long
130 - Or touching one whom you desire with a nature considered ... With usual pleasure, even if male
131 - And touching the penis and touching with the palm ... Or finger, and [touching] a woman is differed upon

Chapter: Relieving Oneself
132 - In human need, be silent and sit ... Recommended; and for urine stand on soft impure ground
133 - And the shade, and the wind, and a hole, and the hard ground ... And the roads, and the water source, all of them avoid
134 - And do not face or turn back to the Kaaba ... In the home permit intercourse and the excretion

148 - And from Semen exiting with pleasure ... Usual, in sleep or in wakefulness
149 - And from the disappearance of the glans in any ... Private part; and washing the dead, or he who embraced Islam

153 - And its Virtue: Starting with washing the filth ... If it was on the body, and the head three times
154 - And washing the organs of Wudu, unite them ... And with the right and the upper parts begin

Chapter: Tayammum, Its Obligations, Sunan, Virtues, and Invalidators
155 - The sick and the traveler perform Tayammum ... For the Obligatory and Voluntary; as for the resident
156 - If he is healthy, for an obligatory prayer and for a funeral ... That became specific, not Friday or Sunnah
157 - If they lacked sufficiency of water ... Or the sick person feared increase of illness
158 - Or from the occurrence of illness or slow recovery ... By experience or from a knowledgeable doctor

160 - Or he feared by using it or seeking it ... The exit of the choice time if he went

163 - And Sunnah: Wiping from hand to elbow ... And renew the strike, and arrange, and be gentle

Chapter: Wiping Over the Splint and the Socks
170 - If you fear washing the wound, like Tayammum ... Then wipe it or what shields it for pain
171 - Like splints or the paper ... Or bandages and binding of the head
172 - And if by washing or without purity, as if ... It spread, if most of the body is healthy
173 - Or what was healthy was little, and washing the sound part ... Did not harm the wound and did not cause pain

Chapter: Menstruation and Postpartum and What the Event Prevents
180 - Menstruation: Blood exiting like turbidity ... From the vagina of one who can carry, or like yellowness

Chapter: Prayer Times
195 - The time for Dhuhr: From the Zawal (Sun decline) ... To the end of the stature (shadow equals object), then the following:
196 - Selected (Mukhtar) of Asr and Necessary (Daruri) of Dhuhr ... To the yellowing, they share by the amount
197 - From the Sunset: Maghrib, so restrict ... To the amount of conditions or disappearance of the twilight
198 - Time of Isha: From it to a third is advanced ... And from it to Fajr is Necessary in both
199 - And Subh (Fajr): From dawn to the brightening ... Or to sunrise is the end of the Selected
200 - Performing it in the Selected time is gain ... And in the Necessary is performance (Ada) and sin
201 - Except for an excuse like menstruation or childhood ... Or sleep or fainting and reason gone
202 - Forgetting, disbelief, apostasy, not intoxication ... And estimate purification for other than disbelief

203 - And the excuse dropped the catchable part obtained ... Not sleep or forgetfulness or if he neglected
204 - And killing the abandoner of it, acknowledging, is serious ... And denying its obligation is an apostate

Chapter: Adhan and Iqamah
205 - And Adhan is Sunnah for a people who sought ... Congregation in any time it becomes obligatory
206 - Except in Subh, then at one-sixth of the night ... And build it doubled except the Takbir/Tahlil
207 - And it is valid from: A responsible person who has submitted (Muslim) ... And a male, in its time he knew
208 - And it is recommended standing, elevated ... Purified, facing Qibla, repeating (Tarji')
209 - And the Iqamah is Sunnah, the preferred ... Single, voweled, connected
210 - With it stand, or after it whenever compulsory ... And if a woman establishes it secretly, it is recommended

Chapter: Conditions of Prayer
211 - Conditions of Obligation for prayer ... Are five coming before the obligation:
212 - Reason, and Islam, Reaching of the Call ... Then Puberty with Entry of the Time
213 - Conditions of its Validity came in the transmission: ... Leaving speech or much action
214 - And covering nakedness, and purity of filth ... Facing the House, lifting the Event (Hadath)

Chapter: Pillars of Prayer, Its Sunan, Virtues, Disliked Acts, and Invalidators
215 - (Pillars of Prayer) are twelve ... Intention in his heart is considered
216 - Second is Takbir of Ihram ... For the individual, the follower, and the Imam
217 - Third is recitation of 'Al-Hamd' (Fatiha) ... Upon the Imam alone and the individual

book_title: The Easiest Paths in the School of Imam Malik (Within the Rif'ah Collection on Texts of the Four Schools)

218 - Then Standing for both if you are able ... Then leaning or sitting, then lie down
219 - Then Ruku (bowing) and Sujud (prostration), so know ... And rising from every pillar of them
220 - And the ninth is Sitting for the Salam ... And between your two prostrations completely
221 - Then have Tranquility in the prayer and be moderate ... And conclude with Salam with 'Al' to comply
222 - (Its Sunan) are thirteen, transmit: ... A Surah in the first two Rak'ahs
223 - And Audible and Silent [recitation] and from standing ... And every Takbir other than Ihram
224 - And 'Sami'a Allahu liman hamidah' ... For an Imam alone and the individual
225 - And the follower remains silent during audible recitation ... And say aloud the Salam of exit, so know
226 - Returning the Salam to the Imam and upon ... Whoever is on the left if he attained a Rak'ah
227 - And a Sutrah (barrier) for the individual and the Imam ... If they fear passing in front
228 - And the First Sitting and what exceeded ... The amount of Salam or upon what provides tranquility
229 - Likewise every Tashahhud, and difference arose ... In its wording: Is it Sunnah or Recommended?
230 - And its Virtue: Raising hands at Ihram ... Likewise praising (Tahmid) except the Imam
231 - Saying 'Amin' for follower and individual absolutely ... Likewise Imam if he spoke silently
232 - And read during the silence of the Imam, you will rest ... And in Ruku and Sujud glorify (Tasbih)
233 - And length in Subh and Dhuhr always ... And in Isha be medium, and shorten the rest
234 - And lengthen the first Rak'ah over the other ... And in the two sittings, the last is prolonged
235 - Saying Takbir at the start [of movement] connected ... Except from two [Rak'ahs] until he stands straight

book_title: The Easiest Paths in the School of Imam Malik (Within the Rif'ah Collection on Texts of the Four Schools)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
236 - Our Qunut with its heard wording ... In Subh secretly preceding Ruku
237 - And it is disliked: Supplication in Ihram ... Or after it or in the high Ruku
238 - Or during Al-Hamd and during the Surah ... Or before it, or a specific supplication
239 - Or supplication in the first sitting ... Or after the Salam of the completing Imam
240 - Or closing eyes and supplication in non-Arabic ... Or his carrying something in sleeve or mouth
241 - Cracking knuckles, interlacing fingers, or hands on hips ... His squatting, and that he thinks of worldly matters
242 - And they invalidated: Prayer of one who laughed aloud ... Or one in minor impurity even if by precedence or he forgot
243 - And eating and drinking and blowing counted ... Vomiting, Greeting, or Speech intentionally
244 - Or he prostrated the Pre-Salam [sujud] who did not bow ... Or offered the Post-Salam [sujud] absolutely, so be aware
245 - Or left the Pre-Salam if time was long ... And it was for a deficiency of three Sunnahs
246 - Or added intentionally a physical pillar ... Or for a virtue [added] a Pre-Salam prostration
247 - Or a pillar or condition intentionally he left ... Or remembering a missed prayer in a shared time
248 - Or two Rak'ahs added in its Subh ... Or four in other than it if he forgot

Chapter: Making Up Missed Prayers and Times of Prohibition and Dislike
249 - And it is obligatory in any time to make up ... Immediately what he missed of obligatory prayer
250 - What shared a time, strictly obligatory ... Is its order; and other than that is a condition only
251 - And arrange the few with the present one ... Like four, and arrange the missed ones
252 - And begin with Dhuhr in all the forgotten ... And forgetting a prayer, he performs the five

book_title: The Easiest Paths in the School of Imam Malik (Within the Rif'ah Collection on Texts of the Four Schools)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
253 - And voluntary prayer is prevented: For tightness of time ... By doing it; and let him make up what is in debt
254 - And when the Khatib ascends the pulpit ... Likewise sunrise and sunset
255 - And they disliked: After the Fajr prayer ... And after Jumu'ah and after Asr
256 - Until Maghrib is prayed or [sun] rises ... Sun, and until it is raised the length of a spear

Chapter: Prostration of Forgetfulness (Sujud al-Sahw)
257 - Two prostrations are Sunnah for forgetfulness, in them ... Let him recite Tashahhud and let him say Salam from them
258 - And it is for deficiency a confirmed Sunnah ... Before his Salam, even if multiple
259 - Like leaving two 'Sami'a Allahu' or one of the Surahs ... Or he stood up from two [Rak'ahs] or spoke secretly in audible
260 - Or leaving two Takbirs or if he lacked ... His two Tashahhuds or sitting for them
261 - And if an addition and deficiency occurred ... Then let the deficiency prevail and prostrate before
262 - And if it was purely an addition ... Then prostrate for it after fulfilling the worship
263 - Like audible in secret and a pillar you add ... And doubt in completion or in number
264 - And eating and drinking and blowing slightly ... And vomiting and Taslim forgetfully, speaking
265 - Or after two he stood straight then sat ... Or in places of standing he reversed
266 - And no prostration suffices for what is obligatory ... Nor for a light Sunnah or recommended act
267 - And the Pre-Salam is prostrated with the Imam ... By he who caught the Rak'ah completely
268 - And delay the Post-Salam absolutely, defer ... And if he contradicts in them intentionally, it is invalid
269 - And every forgetfulness during following ... His Imam bears it regarding Sunnah

book_title: The Easiest Paths in the School of Imam Malik (Within the Rif'ah Collection on Texts of the Four Schools)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
270 - And every forgetfulness that befell the Imam ... His follower follows him even if he did [it]
271 - And he does not stand to make up what he missed ... Until his Imam fulfills his prayer
272 - And the catcher of the Imam stands with Takbir ... In two Rak'ahs or Tashahhud of Salam
273 - And one catching three or one ... Without Takbir he stands; take a benefit

Chapter: Voluntary Prayers and Prostration of Recitation
274 - And voluntary prayer is recommended, so maintain its practice ... Like: After Dhuhr four and before it
275 - Like: Before Asr, increase it after Maghrib ... Before Isha and after it, so encourage
276 - Duha, Tarawih, with the Greeting (Tahiyyah) ... For a mosque, and it is not missed by sitting
277 - And the two Rak'ahs of Fajr with Hamd alone ... A Desirable (Raghibah) or Sunnah, so define it
278 - Then the Lunar Eclipse until the moon clears ... With two Rak'ahs, repeat or [like] Fajr
279 - And recite aloud in night voluntary prayer, you will be given nearness ... And in the day silence, no, possessor of sermon
280 - And every Sunnah and voluntary prayer, know ... From two Rak'ahs, two Rak'ahs, say Salam
281 - And the Prostration of the Quran is Sunnah upon ... Condition of prayer or for voluntary prayer it descended
282 - Without Ihram and without Salam ... For a reciter or one intending learning
283 - From a reciter suitable for leadership (Imamate) ... And he did not make people hear his tunes
284 - Its number is eleven in: The End of ... A'raf, Ra'd, Nahl, Isra, Maryam
285 - Furqan, the first of Hajj, Sad, Naml ... Prostration of Ha-Mim, with the status of voluntary
286 - The follower follows him in it if he recited ... And if it is silent, let him recite it aloud

book_title: The Easiest Paths in the School of Imam Malik (Within the Rif'ah Collection on Texts of the Four Schools)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
Chapter: Confirmed Sunan
287 - And the confirmed Sunan are four: ... Witr is the first of them and highest of them
288 - With one Rak'ah aloud and he reads in it ... With (Qul Huwa Allah) and (its two followers)
289 - And the two Rak'ahs of Shaf' are a condition before it ... With (Sabbihi al-A'la) and (Qul Ya Ayyuha)
290 - Its selected time is after Isha to Fajr ... And after it to Subh is the time of Necessity
291 - And one sleeping through it makes it up for seven ... And Witr and Fajr, and Subh follows
292 - And the five and the four, so perform Shaf' and Witr ... Suffice the three, perform Witr and delay Fajr
293 - And for two, start with Subh and make up ... To the Zawal, the Fajr like the Obligatory
294 - Second of them is Eid upon men ... From time of permissibility of voluntary prayer to Zawal
295 - Saying Takbir six times other than Ihram ... And six in the following [Rak'ah] while standing
296 - And the follower says Takbir if deficiency occurred ... And if his Imam adds, he is not followed
297 - And the catcher of the Imam in his recitation ... Says Takbir for what he missed in his standing
298 - And his two sermons he delayed after prayer ... And in both without limit he says Takbir
299 - And perfume and adornment are recommended ... And Ghusl, but after Fajr is better
300 - And walking and going from a path ... And returning from another, and reviving the night
301 - And eating, advance it on Eid al-Fitr ... And delay eating on the Day of Sacrifice (Nahr)
302 - Saying Takbir from his Dhuhr aloud ... Following five and ten obligations
303 - Say Takbir and Tahlil then Takbir and Tahmid ... And double Takbir and other than it make single

book_title: The Easiest Paths in the School of Imam Malik (Within the Rif'ah Collection on Texts of the Four Schools)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
304 - Then the Solar Eclipse (Kusuf) is two Rak'ahs according to us ... Add in every Rak'ah a standing and bowing
305 - He stands with Baqarah and bows its amount ... And the second with Imran and bow near it
306 - And its two prostrations like the bowing lengthen ... And the other Rak'ah upon this method
307 - So in its two standings Nisa and Ma'idah ... And Al-Hamd in every bowing is added
308 - And lifting for the standing and the sittings ... Like other prayers in forms
309 - And the Rak'ah is caught by the bowing ... The second, like the first placed
310 - And its time is like Eid and read silently ... No sermon in it, but an exhortation
311 - And it binds the resident and the traveler ... And every Bedouin and resident
312 - And the fourth is our Rain Prayer (Istisqa) like Shaf' ... For drinking and the needy or for crops
313 - Like Eid in time upon all mankind ... And the two sermons in them, so seek forgiveness
314 - And return injustice and repent obligatorily ... And fast three before it recommended
315 - And for the cloak after finishing turn around ... And do not reverse; and women do not do [this]

Chapter: Congregational Prayer and Conditions of Imam and Follower
316 - And establishing Congregation is Sunnah ... In our obligatory prayer and obligatory in Jumu'ah
317 - And its virtue is twenty-seven came ... For one catching all of it or a Rak'ah
318 - An individual repeats with an Imam if he wishes ... Not Maghrib or after Witr for Isha
319 - And ten (Conditions of the Imam): ... Male with Reason and Islam
320 - And Ability and Knowledge of what is binding ... Of Fiqh or Recitation, Puberty

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
321 - And neither a follower nor one repeating [prayer]... in Friday prayer, a free resident is added.
322 - And (ten are disliked) in voluntary prayer:... leadership of the amputee and the paralyzed.
323 - And one with sores leading the healthy, or one with incontinence... likewise a Bedouin even if his mention [of knowledge] is old.
324 - And like him, ranked, is the castrated one... or the uncircumcised who is safe [in faith], or the innovator.
325 - One of unknown condition or a disliked Imam... and the slave, though not in Friday prayer, they have disliked [his leadership].
326 - And it is permitted for the impotent to lead... and whoever opposes our branch [opinion], and the blind.
327 - And like him is the one with a speech impediment and the one punished for slander... and the leper if mild, not the severe.
328 - Upon the Imam is an intention in four cases:... The one appointing a successor, fear [prayer], and combining [prayers], and Friday prayer.
329 - And stipulate upon the follower: the intention of following... and that they be united in the prayer.
330 - He follows the Imam in the Ihram (opening)... and in performance and its opposite [Qada] and the Salam.
331 - And they disliked preceding an Imam... or equality [in position] without crowding.
332 - And this is permitted due to crowding or harm... and the separation of a follower by a house or a river.
333 - Or if the follower is elevated on a roof, for example... and invalidate the prayer of his Imam if he [the Imam] is elevated.
334 - Except if it was the amount of a hand span... and invalidate both their prayers if intended for arrogance.
335 - And everything that is invalid for the Imam... invalidate it for his follower, even if he [the follower] performed it.
336 - Except for forgetting ritual impurity or his being preceded [by the Imam]... like a laugher overcome or one giggling.
337 - Invalidate it upon him [the Imam] excluding them, and they appoint a successor... like his death or his incapacity or if he has a nosebleed.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
Chapter on Friday Prayer
338 - An individual obligation is the Friday prayer... count the conditions of its obligation as six:
339 - Maleness, freedom, residency... and proximity, settlement, then health.
340 - As for the conditions of its performance, there are four:... A congregation with its safety, and the Mosque [Jami'].
341 - Then a preaching resident Imam... and two sermons in which he stands.
342 - And prevent speech or greeting during them... and by the Adhan for sitting, forbid [trade].
343 - Like sale, pre-emption, and speculation... so annul it, but not things like marriage and gifting.
344 - And they disliked voluntary prayer at the Adhan... like leaving it [Friday prayer] for work or employment.
345 - Or travel that he starts after Fajr... and at Zawal (midday) prevent it due to the intense heat.
346 - And a bath connected to the departure is recommended... whoever slept or ate should repeat it.
347 - And its valid excuse for absence:... Nakedness and nursing a close relative near death.
348 - And his watching over the state of a dying person... and abundance of mud and severity of rain.
349 - Or illness or his being beaten unjustly... or his imprisonment by injustice or being destitute.
350 - Or his senility or his eating something like garlic... or one who harms people like the leper.
351 - And like him is the blind man who is not guided... by himself or does not find a guide.

Chapter on Shortening and Combining Prayers
352 - The distance for shortening in miles is:... Fifty except two consecutively [48 miles].
353 - Even if by sea all at once, going... in a permissible journey or returning.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
354 - Shortening the four-unit prayer in it or from it is recommended... with the intention of shortening if the dwelling is passed.
355 - And cut it [the shortening] by intention or if he arrives... at his homeland or a wife with whom he has consummated marriage.
356 - Or if he follows a resident [Imam] or intends residence... of four [days] or knowledge of it by habit.
357 - And they granted concession on land when the sun declines... at a watering place while he has intended to stop.
358 - At the setting of the sun or after it... presenting the two Dhuhrs [Dhuhr and Asr] when striving [in travel].
359 - Before yellowing [of the sun], delay Asr only... and after it, give him choice in them without excess.
360 - And if it passes its zenith while he is riding... and at yellowing he seeks to dismount.
361 - He delays the two Dhuhrs to the necessary time... or after that combine them in form [Suriy].
362 - So he performs Dhuhr at the time of the end... of its preferred time, and Asr at the beginning of its time.
363 - And from a healthy or formidable person it is accepted... and in the two Ishas [Maghrib and Isha], follow the detail of what passed.
364 - Its setting is like the Zawal, and the twilight... is like the yellowing, and the setting is like the dawn break.
365 - And they granted concession in combining on the night of rain... due to it, like mud with dark gloom.
366 - Delay Maghrib a little after the call... and pray it, and for Isha renew,
367 - Its Adhan, then pray in sequence... and go and delay its Witr after the twilight.

Chapter on the Dying Person and His Preparation
368 - Know - with certainty - every soul is perishing... and every self will taste death.
369 - Upon the sick: to repent quickly... and washing every disease in the heart.
370 - And to return usurped property and wrongs... and pay the debt or the trust.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
371 - And writing a document with him... regarding what rights are for him or against him.
372 - And to continue remembrance and supplication... and praise and Tahlil (saying La ilaha illa Allah) and eulogy.
373 - Sending blessings upon the Chosen Messenger... seeking forgiveness for what he committed or erred.
374 - He reads the supplication of Dhul-Nun forty times... and Al-Ra'd and Al-Ikhlas with Yasin.
375 - And he thinks well of the pardon of his Lord... and the greatness of his sin does not make him despair.
376 - And it is appropriate to prompt him with the Testimony [Shahada]... so that the end may be with happiness.
377 - Face him [to Qibla] while laying him on his side and close [his eyes]... and bind his jaws gently if he passes away.
378 - And place a heavy object upon the stomach of the dead... and soften his limbs with that which is best.
379 - And the living are obliged for the dead... regarding the shroud, the burial, and the prayer.
380 - And the washing; and the spouses are prioritized in it... even if she is a Dhimmi and he is Muslim.
381 - Then the guardians (Awliya), then a man, then a Mahram... then other than her; for mere accompaniment, perform Tayammum.
382 - And if it is a female, then a female is brought near... then other than relatives, or for the lack [of women], perform Tayammum.
383 - And the washing in its form is like Janaba... and covering the nakedness (Awrah), they narrated its obligation.
384 - And they permitted a nursing female for a man... and like a boy of seven, a woman may wash him.
385 - And the lack of rubbing due to a matter that occurred... and gathering dead bodies due to lack of space in a grave.
386 - And the shroud is recommended without delay... and Sidr and camphor in the last [wash].
387 - And squeeze his stomach gently and on... a raised place put him, and wash an odd number of times.
388 - And do not remove hair nor nail, and whoever... removed something, let him place it in the shroud.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
389 - And the obligatory shroud is what covers... his nakedness, and the rest is Sunnah, it appeared.
390 - And it is upon the spender by ownership... or kinship, except for the marital relationship.
391 - And whiteness and perfuming are recommended... and impure [cloth] or silk is disliked.
392 - Then the prayer is necessary for the washing... whoever you did not wash, do not pray over.
393 - Such as lack of crying out [at birth] or a martyr... or a disbeliever or the loss of most of the body.
394 - Its pillars: Standing and the Salam... likewise the intention and the Ihram (Takbir).
395 - And after it three Takbirs... and between them let him supplicate for the dead.
396 - And it is recommended: Starting it with praise... and with blessings upon the Prophet with care.
397 - At the shoulder of the female and the middle of the man... so stand, and make the head of the dead to your right.
398 - And his burial, the least of it: that it prevents... odor, and protection of the dead who is placed.
399 - The relative throws dirt for him in it... and for food, make it for his family.
400 - And screaming and wailing are prohibited... and patience is obligatory, and condolences are beloved.

Chapter on Zakat of Livestock, Crops, Gold/Silver, Its Recipients and Zakat al-Fitr
401 - Obligate Zakat on the quorum of livestock... by: The year and ownership for a free Muslim.
402 - In every five camels, a Jaza'ah (one year old)... sheep, up to twenty after four.
403 - Twenty-five, a Makhad (one-year-old camel), and the Labun (two-year-old)... for thirty-six it exists.
404 - In forty-six, a Hiqqah (three-year-old)... sixty-one, upon it a Jaza'ah (four-year-old).
405 - Seventy-six, two Labuns... ninety-one, then two Hiqqahs.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
406 - For one hundred and twenty-nine... and after it change the obligations of Zakat.
407 - A Labun for every forty... and a Hiqqah is given for fifty.
408 - The age of Makhad is a year, then proceed... year by year, and the symbols are (Milhaj).
409 - Then thirty is the quorum for cows... in it a Tabi' (one-year-old), a male of two years.
410 - A Musinna (two-year-old) in every forty... that has reached three years.
411 - In forty sheep, one sheep is the Zakat... given up to one hundred and twenty.
412 - And after it two sheep for two hundred... then three if it grows from these.
413 - Then four are given for four hundred... for every hundred, a sheep is the Zakat.
414 - And Bukht (camels) are added to Arabi, and goats... to sheep, and buffalo to cows are counted.
415 - The amount of quorum for dates and grains:... Five Awsuq with the condition of ripeness.
416 - By the Ardabb of Egypt, four and a Waybah... and by the Rashidi, take an approximation.
417 - Three with the price of an Ardabb became clear... meaning one hundred after fifty Qadah.
418 - Twenty types gather them, so count... seven pulses are like one type.
419 - Peas, chickpeas, broad beans, lentils... and chickpeas and kidney beans and lupin.
420 - For wheat and sult (barley type), barley is added... if each is planted before harvest.
421 - And six, their types are separate... the quorum of each one is on its own:
422 - Millet, rice, corn, likewise alas (wheat type)... dates, raisins, its estimation is when dried.
423 - And those with oils are four: Sesame... olives, radish seeds, then safflower.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
424 - So half a tenth if irrigated by cost... or otherwise a tenth, or both by proportion.
425 - Twenty Dinars is the quorum of gold... or two hundred Dirhams of silver, so calculate.
426 - Or from both, exchange every ten... of it for a Dinar, and the people of the age,
427 - Have edited the struck coin of all gold... in our Egypt like the Bunduqi and Maghribi.
428 - Twenty plus three and a half... and half a seventh of a tenth of this, or classify.
429 - And our silver by the Dog [coin] and the Riyal... twenty and two and a following quarter.
430 - And it is eighty-five plus one hundred... Dirhams with five-eighths, it is.
431 - He brings out a quarter of a tenth in both types... and the year is a condition and the absence of debt.
432 - And silver is permitted in the Zakat of gold... and the reverse, likewise Fulous (copper coins), so collect.
433 - Its recipients: The poor and the needy... and slavery and the worker and the debtor.
434 - Those whose hearts are reconciled, and the wayfarer on a journey... and in the way of Allah, so that is the eighth.
435 - Its intention upon payout is obligatory... in the place of obligation or in the nearest.
436 - Except if the distant one is more destitute... then carry the majority to him and advance a month.
437 - And they also obligated Zakat al-Fitr... and its amount is a Sa' by the obligation of the Sunnah.
438 - From the dominant staple food upon the legally responsible... and it does not lapse, and it suffices by the predecessor.
439 - On behalf of himself or those he is obliged to feed... given to a free poor Muslim.

Chapter on Fasting
440 - Fasting the month is established by completing... Sha'ban or by sighting the crescent.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
441 - Either by two just witnesses or widespread news... of a group that does not usually lie.
442 - So with establishment, abstain even after dawn break... and the ruling of Shawwal is on this pattern.
443 - And whoever intended fasting without certainty... and that day became clear to be from Ramadan.
444 - He makes it up and proceeds on his abstinence... and expiation (Kaffarah) is required by violating it.
445 - And the day of doubt is fasted for voluntary observance... and vows if it coincides, and consecutive fasting [of Kaffarah].
446 - Not for precaution, and upon him is to make up... a day even if it coincided with the day of obligation.
447 - Obligate it by: The month and by puberty... and it is valid with sanity and Islam.
448 - And an intention preceding Fajr... in every fast, and it suffices [once] for the month.
449 - Like every fast obligatory in sequence... like [expiation for] killing and Zihar, not voluntary.
450 - And purity from things like menstruation before Fajr... and it is valid before the Ghusl after purity.
451 - And leaving the emission of semen that is induced... and vomiting and Madhy (pre-seminal fluid) or intercourse.
452 - And leaving the delivery of what dissolves... to a stomach or a throat, not like the urethra.
453 - Forgetting this in the obligatory requires makeup (Qada)... like the fluid of one who uses Siwak or rinses mouth.
454 - And doubt regarding Fajr or sunset... or swallowing phlegm that is overcome.
455 - Or intentionally breaking fast in voluntary prayer is prohibited... even if he swore upon himself by divorce.
456 - And no makeup in dominant cases of Madhy... or vomit or from phlegm or semen.
457 - Nor a fly, dust of the road... or the maker of gypsum or flour.
458 - And five, in their intentional doing, require Kaffarah... except by a close interpretation that is excused.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
459 - In Ramadan absolutely by choice... so lifting the intention during the day.
460 - Or eating or drinking by mouth intentionally... or from intercourse or semen intentionally.
461 - And it is by choice: either he gives... sixty poor people, for each a Mudd.
462 - Or fasts two months consecutive in sequence... or frees a believing slave, sound and free.
463 - And whoever slackens in making up Ramadan... neglecting until the second comes.
464 - Upon him obligatorily for every day... is feeding a Mudd along with making up the fast.
465 - Like a nursing woman who feared for the little one... and there was no wealth for a wet nurse.
466 - Or the child would not accept other than her... or a pregnant woman fearing for the one she carries.
467 - And a ransom (Fidyah) is recommended for the senile... or the thirsty [permanently ill], both did not fast.
468 - Likewise hastening the breaking of fast... and like it delaying the Suhoor.
469 - And fasting the Day of Standing [Arafah] for the non-pilgrim... and the ninth and tenth of Muharram.
470 - And six from the month of Shawwal just as... three from every month, generalize.
471 - And fasting Friday and the [whole] year is permitted... likewise using Siwak after Dhuhr.
472 - And the breaking of fast for one who traveled before Fajr... the distance of shortening with the intention of breaking fast.
473 - Rinsing of the thirsty like cupping... for the healthy who does not fear illness.
474 - And for the sick, they disliked cupping... and tasting like salt or swallowing it.
475 - Preliminaries of intercourse where it is known... safety from ejaculation, otherwise they are prohibited.
476 - But if he ejaculated, he makes up and expiates... and where he emitted Madhy, then makeup is established.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
477 - And it is not permitted for a wife to perform voluntary... Hajj, fasting, or I'tikaf at all.
478 - Except with permission, and he has the right to annul it... upon the one he needs, so let her ask him.

Chapter on I'tikaf (Retreat)
479 - And I'tikaf, its ruling is a virtue... its minimum: a day and part of a night.
480 - Its conditions: Discernment and Islam... and the permissible Mosque and Fasting.
481 - And his occupation: his prayer and his remembrance... reading, and other than this is disliked.
482 - Like: his studying of knowledge or writing it... or his I'tikaf without his sufficiency [of supplies].
483 - And by leaving, invalidate it, or by breaking fast... or by causes of intercourse or like drunkenness.

Chapter on Hajj and Umrah
484 - Hajj for the capable is an obligation once... in his life, likewise Umrah is recommended.
485 - Its conditions: His Islam, his freedom... and his sanity, his puberty, his ability.
486 - And it is: The arrival with his return to... a place of livelihood with safety for,
487 - Self and wealth along with performing the obligation... even if by walking or begging that leads [to it].

752 - And by transfer of ownership the slave girl is cleared... by a menstruation, not his wife or prohibited one.

754 - And clear by ninety who was small... even with safety of pregnancy or who was old.
755 - Or her menstruation with irregular bleeding ran... and she did not distinguish or for illness delayed.
756 - Or by breastfeeding or without causes... if she did not doubt, and the year with doubt.
757 - And clear the pregnant by delivery for him... and prohibited is enjoyment of a master before it.
758 - And the free woman, her clearance is like Iddah... not in Li'an or adultery or apostasy.
759 - For she in all this is cleared... by a menstruation only, you are sufficed the harm.

Chapter on the Missing Person
760 - For loss there are states, so the first: Loss of... a husband in the land of Muslims, they counted.
761 - If she raised her matter to the Muslims... or a judge or ruler, with it he gave her a term.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
762 - Four years and for slavery half... after waiting and searching revealed.
763 - Second of them: Missing in the land of polytheism... his wife remains without doubt.
764 - Seventy years the period of life... from his age like the wife of the prisoner.
765 - Third: The missing in the time of tribulations... between possessors of Islam or was a time of,
766 - Plague or one going to a land... its plague increased in it and convened.
767 - His wife counts Iddah when separated... the war and the plague cleared from them.
768 - Fourth: The missing in a war that occurred... between Islam and Kufr and lifted.
769 - She counts Iddah after the search for him, the free woman... a year, and the one of slavery from him half.
770 - And the Iddah of the four is like death... if spending continued on the wives.

Chapter on Breastfeeding
771 - If reached the stomach of the child in two years... milk of a female or increased two months.
772 - Prohibit by it what they prohibited by lineage... except what the people of the Madhab excepted:
773 - Mother of your sister, mother of your brother, mother of your aunt... and mother of uncle, mother of maternal uncle, your aunt.
774 - And grandmother of the son and sister of the child... and mother of the son's child, take, do not transgress.
775 - And she is estimated a mother and her husband a father... from his intercourse milk became lawful in it.
776 - For two women before a contract accept... if it spread like a woman with a man.
777 - And establish by two witnesses breastfeeding absolutely... and his parents before a contract are believed.
778 - Not after it and no establishment by the woman... even if spread, and spread the breastfeeding of disbelievers.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
Chapter on Maintenance
779 - Spend on the slave and animals... if there is no pasture, upon obligation.
780 - And whoever refused forcefully upon him, let it be sold... like a burden or tasking what is not able.
781 - And the father spends on the son until... his puberty as free with earning he reasoned.
782 - And for entry of the husband with the female as... a capable calls for him, having dreamt.
783 - And the destitute parents, spends... upon them the son with ease, kind.
784 - For the wife of the poor father, the one... and a servant also for her, not an extra.
785 - And a wife for an adult if she enabled... capable, not dying or approaching death.
786 - And even if for Hajj she traveled or fell ill... or she imprisoned him or for him she was imprisoned.
787 - And spending is dropped by her eating with him... or her preventing enjoyment or intercourse.
788 - Or she went out without his permission nor... for returning her does it strengthen if she did not conceive.
789 - And spending is dropped for a time passed... by his poverty if not estimated by judgment.
790 - And spend on her in revocable divorce... with clothing and housing by capacity.
791 - And spend on the pregnant without housing... even if by Khul' or irrevocable divorce.
792 - And prevent even with pregnancy those who did Li'an... and the wife of the dead, but she resides.
793 - If the husband paid the rent before... death or ownership for him originally.
794 - And the wife and the revocable are obliged... to nurse her two children except the high status.
795 - Or in daughters when the boy does not accept... a wet nurse other than her or by destitution of the father.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
796 - And return to the child with what you spent... in his known wealth if you swore.

Chapter on Custody
797 - For the mother is custody to puberty in the male... or the female enters [marriage], obligatorily considered.
798 - Then her mothers, then the aunt of the boy... her aunts, then the father after the father's mother.
799 - Sister then his paternal aunt, then the adequate designate... from daughter of a sister or brother then the executor.
800 - Brother then grandfather then son of every patron... higher then lower, grandfather of a mother is before.
801 - Prioritize a full brother then a son of mother then son of father... and nine are its conditions for who counted:
802 - Competence, trustworthiness, sanity, safety... from like leprosy, his rectitude, protection known.
803 - Vacancy of a female from like a foreign husband... and brought a female who has custody of the boy.
804 - And did not travel six of the Burud... free from the custody by moving did not return.

Chapter on Sale and What Relates to It
805 - The sale is contracted by: What indicated... consent by word seen or action.
806 - From a contracting party, responsible, rational... in his property, and the condition in the contract object.
807 - Upon it: able to deliver it... and no text came on its prohibition.
808 - And pure legally, by it is benefitted... and knowing all with what he pays.
809 - Sale of the curious (Fuduli) is halted and the pawnbroker... on consent of the owner or one who pawned.
810 - And if a slave committed a crime, the master of the slave... has choice in paying him or redeeming.
811 - And prevent usury of excess and delay... in cash and food, not in water.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
812 - And they prohibited in sale hiding the defect... and deception and Najsh (bidding up) like dyeing grey hair.
813 - Or increase the debt on him for delay... or what is on him annul it in deferred.
814 - Put down and pay or a loan dragged benefit... and for Juzaf (estimation) count conditions seven.
815 - They did not intend its isolation and his ignorance... they estimated it and its place was level.
816 - And it was seen and not very much... and counting it without hardship is difficult.

Chapter on Corrupt Sale
817 - And every sale that was forbidden is corrupt... if it was not supported to evidence.
818 - Like: His selling meat for a living animal of its genus... or sale of a garment by pebbles or touching it.
819 - Or sell it for the value or what judged... with it so-and-so if binding by all.
820 - Or unknown term or like the fetus... or buy it and spend on it its term.
821 - Or condition of pregnancy or by separating the child... from his mother before teething, it corrupted.
822 - Or he sold with a condition against the intent... like: I sold you the house with condition of demolition.
823 - And every corrupt sale, did not flow... its guarantee except by possession of the buyer.
824 - In it is the named for the disputed corruption... and value belonging to it the day of loss.
825 - And in valid sale by contract guarantee... to its owner in its loss for the price.

Chapter on Option (Khiyar)
826 - And they permitted sale on option... like Friday for the slave and a month for the house.
827 - And other than this three like the garment... for the buyer is return without defect.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
828 - Its guarantee is from the seller in this term [of option]... and unfairness (Ghabn) in a sale that occurred does not harm.
829 - And whoever stumbled upon a defect in the sold item... allow him the return, even if a final sale occurred.
830 - And whoever saw an old defect, then occurred... a new defect while with him, he is given the choice:
831 - In returning it with the compensation (Arsh) for the subsequent defect... or keeping it and taking the compensation for the previous one.
832 - And every defect that is not seen unless... the commodity is spoiled or the harm grows,
833 - Like almonds and cucumbers and the rotting of wood... there is no return in it.. nay, nor is compensation obligatory.
834 - And the warranty of a year regarding slavery is specified... for madness, leprosy, and vitiligo.
835 - And the warranty of three [days] if custom dictates... or its condition is for every defect that occurred.

Chapter on What Enters into Sale and What Does Not, and Sale of Grains and Fruits
836 - The land includes the building and the trees... and it is both of them, except like crops being sown.
837 - And the house [includes] what was nailed or built... and by the lower millstone, the upper is acquired.
838 - For the buyer of a slave are the clothes of profession... and wealth is by condition, like the dress of adornment.
839 - And the sale of grains and fruit is not permitted... before their suitability appears (ripeness), nor vegetables.
840 - Unless sold with their root or attached... to the root, or they agreed on the condition of cutting.
841 - Its appearance [ripeness] is by coloring or appearance of... sweetness or by the opening of the blossom.
842 - And ripeness and feeding in legumes... or others from the rest of the roots.
843 - And blights (Jawa'ih) of dates are nine that reduce [the price]... as long as not sold with their root or cut:
844 - Rain and birds then a thief, mouse... wind, locusts, rotting, an army, fire.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
845 - If it reached a third; and in legumes... or thirst, the reduction is for the little amount.

Chapter on Salam (Forward Sale)
846 - And permissible in every thing to be sold by Salam... with seven of the conditions known:
847 - So possession of the capital, then the term... of half a month, and it is of what can be transported.
848 - And the description and specification by a measure known... and its being a debt upon the one receiving.
849 - And available at the arrival of the term... and even if it exists before it, it is not acquired.
850 - It is not given in [exchange for] more or better... of its genus, from lower or worse.
851 - Except if the benefits were... different and the intent is occurring.
852 - And not two foods nor two cash currencies... and permitted in imported goods like two days [distance].

Chapter on Loans (Qard)
853 - And lend what Salam is permitted in... except female slaves, not a wife or Mahram.
854 - And they prohibited a gift to the judge... and the owner of the debt or the Qirad.
855 - And a worker in it, and whoever owes... a debt until the repayment of what he has.
856 - Except if the like of it preceded... or a cause between them demanded it.

Chapter on Pledge (Rahn)
857 - The pledge is guaranteed by the mortgagee (pledge holder)... even if he negated liability by a condition, it is weak.
858 - Unless evidence is established on the loss... or its placement with a trustee if he swore.
859 - And it is completed by possession, and permitted with uncertainty (Gharar)... and the yield of the pledge is restricted to its owner.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
860 - And the pledge becomes void by: death of the one who pledged... or his bankruptcy before the mortgagee takes possession.
861 - Or the permission of its possessor to the owner of the pledge... in selling or intercourse or gifting or dwelling.
862 - Like a pledger regarding a specific object or benefit... and its offspring and wool are included with it.

Chapter on Bankruptcy (Falas)
863 - If debt surrounded the debtor... and he did not find with him fulfillment of the debt.
864 - The judge declares him bankrupt even if he did not attend... and from his disposal of wealth, interdict him.
865 - And his wealth is sold by choice... up to three [days] while he is in confinement.
866 - And the wife shares with the people of debts... with her debt and dowry when established.
867 - And due becomes what he owes of debts... like his death, not his wealth [owed to him] as debt.

Chapter on Interdiction (Hajr)
868 - Interdiction is from seven: Madness or childhood... and slavery, not the permitted one and the Mukatab.
869 - And foolishness (Safah), squandering of wealth... in pleasure and lawful desire.
870 - And a wife in other than a third [of her wealth] is objected to... likewise a sick person who died in that sickness.
871 - In other than what is eaten or worn... or medicine; and the seventh: The bankrupt.

Chapter on Debt Transfer (Hawalah)
872 - And seven are the conditions of transfer:... Consent of the transferee and the one who transferred him.
873 - If a fixed debt is due and binding... and a formula, and no enmity between them.
874 - The two debts were equal in amount and description... and it is not from sale of food, so know it.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
875 - And no recourse for the transferee if he found... this debtor of his destitute or he denied.

Chapter on Guarantee (Daman)
876 - Valid is the guarantee of one who can donate... and slavery, but after manumission he is pursued.
877 - And valid from a permitted slave or Mukatab... with permission from their master in it, it is collected.
878 - And a wife in her third, like the one of sickness... its types are three, not broken:
879 - So the guarantor of wealth is bound by payment... if this guaranteed person died or became destitute.
880 - And the guarantor of the face (presence), bind him with payment... if he does not bring his opponent to the disputant.
881 - And demanding, demand him to the extent of ability... by his inability regarding it, no fine he sees.
882 - And absolutely not pursued is the one who sponsored... with the presence of the guaranteed in the state of solvency.
883 - Clearance of the guaranteed clears the guarantor... and the reverse does not clear a debtor existing.

Chapter on Partnership (Sharikah)
884 - And permitted is partnership of (bodies/labor)... with the unity of action and place.
885 - And partnership of (wealth) is also legislated... and the profit between them is distributed.
886 - By the amount of what each of them brought out... of capital, and other than this is prohibited.

Chapter on Sharecropping (Muzara'ah)
887 - Four are the conditions of sharecropping:... Equality of the two seeds and mixing with it.
888 - And meeting the land with other than seed... nor with prohibited things for land you rent.
889 - And in corruption, if the work was equal... make them partners in the crop and return what exceeded.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
890 - And a worker, and the second paid money... for the worker is the crop and whoever paid is given [wage].

Chapter on Agency (Wakalah)
891 - And everything he is permitted to do... by himself, it is permitted that he delegates.
892 - In every action accepting representation... like: Sale and admission and writing.
893 - And Hajj and dispute and debt transfer... and annulment and pre-emption and cancellation.
894 - And his being without oath a trustee... believed in returning goods or price.

Chapter on Admission (Iqrar)
895 - And valid is the admission of: a rational responsible person... and from him the description of coercion and interdiction is negated.
896 - And our slave, in other than wealth is accepted... his admission, and the free regarding it [wealth], they relied upon.

Chapter on Claiming Lineage (Istihqaq)
897 - And for the father is claiming lineage of unknown descent... even if old or by death he has gone.
898 - And assume inheritance for him if a son supported him... and the physiognomists identified a doubtful child.

Chapter on Deposit (Wadi'ah)
899 - Its guarantee from the trustee has dropped... because it is a trust even if he stipulated.
900 - Except by causes of aggression like: if occurred... a transgression from him upon it, you do not leave.
901 - Or moving it without moving its like... or the place of deposit, by forgetfulness he lost it.
902 - Or thought it his property before the damage... or paying it to another without cause.
903 - Except to like a wife or fear of harm... or a servant who tends to it or from travel.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
904 - And the trustee is believed that he returned... except with witnessing for possession he intended.
905 - And they believed him regarding loss and damage... and the accused is fined unless he swore.

Chapter on Loan of Use (Ariyah)
906 - From one without interdiction, the ruling of Ariyah... recommended in property or in loan.
907 - To one who has eligibility of the loaned item... with a formula like: A Mushaf for the reader.
908 - And the benefit in it is with the remaining of the item... a permissible benefit not like intercourse of a slave girl.
909 - Its guarantee in what is hidden is obligatory... as long as evidence is not established on the damage.
910 - And permitted for the permitted person to do... in his action or its like or less.
911 - And if he exceeded in transgression without damage... rent for what he exceeded upon it is obligatory.
912 - Or if damaged, its owner is given choice... in taking its value or taking the rent.
913 - If the owner claimed that it was rent... and he said: This is a loan, or denied.
914 - Then the saying is the owner's but he swears... if he was not one to disdain from the like of this.

Chapter on Usurpation (Ghasb) and Entitlement
915 - And the usurper guarantees by obligation... by the very seizing of the usurped.
916 - And if a usurper transgressed and changed... - even by driving [animals] - its owner is given choice.
917 - In his taking of his usurped thing... or the value of the usurped before the defect.
918 - And the destroyer of fungible things, bind with the like... or the value of the destroyed from the estimated.
919 - And one having intercourse with a slave, upon him is the Hadd... and his child from this girl is a slave.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
920 - And a planter by transgression or one who built... so removal and demolition is appointed upon him.
921 - Or his paying the specific building and trees... valued after deducting the wages.
922 - And take it for free if he did not benefit... by his crop or came secretly, it did not rise.
923 - And what has benefit is for the owner of the crop... or buy it after deducting the removal.
924 - As long as it is not the time of planting the land... for if it is, then judge with the rent of a year.
925 - And a planter by doubt like one who rented... then for its owner is only the rent.
926 - And the one entitled to the land from one of doubt... after building or planting or development.
927 - He gives the building or his planting by value... or leaving it and taking the rent of the plot.
928 - If each of them refused that... they share by the two values in them.
929 - And won the yield five forever:... Whoever returned for defect, and sale that was corrupt.
930 - Or it went out of his hand by pre-emption... or was entitled from the hands of one with doubt.
931 - And like this a bankrupt if he bought... so its owner is more entitled to it without doubt.

Chapter on Pre-emption (Shuf'ah)
932 - And pre-emption is permitted in the shared... of land or roots or quarters.
933 - Or fruit of a branch lasting in stability... or cotton or eggplant or cucumbers.
934 - By taking it from a stranger by purchase... from one who shares with him in the like of what he bought.
935 - If there is multiplicity in it, they share... each by what was specified for him of what he owned.
936 - And no pre-emption for a neighbor or what was gifted... without compensation nor inheritance is it obligatory.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
937 - Or divisible or movable... or one silent with his knowledge like the year.
938 - Or present at the contract like seeing the building... and demolition like two months, there is no dispensing with it.
939 - Or he shared with the pre-emptor who bought it... or sold or bought from him or rented.

Chapter on Qirad (Profit Sharing)
940 - Our Qirad: Deputizing in trade is binding... by action in cash with minted [coins] known.
941 - For a part of its profit and knowledge of the capital... and do not hold the worker liable in any case.

Chapter on Leasing (Ijarah) and What Relates to It
942 - And they stipulated for the validity of leasing... conditions of the sold item and its consideration.
943 - Its guarantee from the hired hand has dropped... even if its owner stipulated it upon him.
944 - And the shepherd is believed in the claim of death... or slaughter like the sheep for fear of loss.
945 - And do not hold liable the guard of the bath... or its owner or the shepherd of livestock.
946 - Or the guard of goods and houses... and the owner of ships like the sailor.
947 - If there was not from their action what appears... of transgression in it or falling short.
948 - And guarantee if you violated a pasture stipulated... like a craftsman in the very product only.
949 - If he set himself up for a craft... even if without wage for what he caused to disappear.
950 - As long as evidence is not established on destruction... or he brought the work according to what he specified.
951 - If there is no mortgagee on the rent... or he received the wage, then this is a trustee.
952 - And one renting an animal guarantees... if he rented it to one not trusted.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
953 - Or increased a load or distance, obligate... for him two rents if it was not damaged.
954 - Or if damaged, the owner of the animal chooses... either two rents or the value.

Chapter on Reward (Ju'l)
955 - And Ju'l is permitted and binding by work... without condition of cash or setting a term.
956 - Like: selling a garment or like: digging a well... and by completion give him all the wage.

Chapter on Reviving Dead Land
957 - And reviving is permitted for: Land safe... from specializations if it was far.
958 - For a Muslim or Disbeliever, and what is near... to developments, the Imam is asked for permission.
959 - And what is without permission takes the ruling of the usurper... and the Dhimmi is prevented from the Arabian Peninsula.
960 - And revival happens by: Cutting trees... and plowing and planting and breaking stones.
961 - And flowing water to it and exploding [springs]... and by building, not fencing and walling.

Chapter on Endowment (Waqf)
962 - Endowment is recommended and the condition of the endower:... Responsible and interdiction is negated from him.
963 - In his property even if by inheritance or purchase... or benefit like monopoly or rent.
964 - By a formula, and the condition in it is followed... and perfected by possession and definitely not sold.
965 - And the state of the beneficiary, know... eligible for ownership even if he did not submit [Islam].
966 - And whoever upon his ward endowed... a house of his, from himself he accepted.
967 - For him, so its dwelling is prohibited upon him... but he rents it for him until puberty.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
968 - And whoever endowed upon specific people... it returns after them to him or his successor.

Chapter on Gift (Hibah)
969 - Permitted are gifts of what is sold from one without... interdiction, with a formula and possession completed.
970 - And whoever gifted to a stranger... either he pays value or returns.
971 - And return [revoke] against other than relatives... and other than the destitute and orphans.
972 - And the saying is the giver's with an oath that appeared... if there was no custom witnessing the opposite.
973 - And the father squeezes [revokes] the gift from the child... as long as he [the child] did not incur debt or gift it or marry.

Chapter on Lost Property (Luqatah)
974 - If you find a lost item, for a year renew... its announcement in the like of: the door of the Mosque.
975 - And after that do with it what you wish... and if you gift it or own it, guarantee.
976 - And the describer of: The container and the strap... and the number is given it without oath.
977 - If it perished without moving, there is no... guarantee in a year nor in what followed.
978 - And whatever spoils, eat it and guarantee... to its owner from a like or from price.
979 - What strayed of sheep or cows... is not taken except for fear of harm.
980 - And the abandoned child must optionally be picked up... and his custody is a right upon you stipulated.
981 - If the child has no wealth that became clear... and return to his father if he cast him intentionally.

Chapter on Judiciary and Testimony
982 - The people of Judiciary: Just, and if not found... a Mujtahid, then the most exemplary imitator (Muqallid).

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
983 - And a male with intelligence, and recommended:... Integrity, forbearance, wealth, knowledge, lineage.
984 - And consulting, not with debt, and pious... and they disliked in the court session: Sales.
985 - And added in the right of the Supreme Imam... that he belongs to Quraysh.
986 - And they executed a ruling judged by a deaf person... and dismiss him immediately like blindness and dumbness.
987 - In his session he equalizes between disputants... even if they are: Disbeliever and Muslim.
988 - So the plaintiff begins with speech... and the defendant remains silent with respect.
989 - So this one claims: a known thing due... and the defendant is asked about: the origin of the cause.
990 - If he admits, judge, otherwise evidence... the plaintiff establishes it in what he specified.
991 - Or the defendant swears or the oath is returned... upon him in financial matters, not claims of accusation.
992 - As for Quraysh, the most correct is (Fihr)... their gathering, and the majority say (Al-Nadr).
993 - And after an oath no witnesses are accepted... except for forgetting them or he was ignorant.
994 - And whoever denied association does not swear even if... the plaintiff proved it by the appropriate face.
995 - So the present one denying [owning] witnesses for the judgment... it is rejected for belying them in what passed.
996 - And remove by the ruling of the judge the disagreement... and he does not make lawful a prohibited thing if he was unjust.
997 - And annul it if he contradicted the ruling of the people... from: Text or Consensus or Analogy.
998 - And whoever possessed real estate like ten [years] against... one not a partner or relative and without,
999 - Excuse, a resident silent while he sees... the building and demolition or taking rent.
1000 - Then no witnesses or claims are accepted... except with housing and endowment, they exemplified.

book_title: Ashhal al-Masalik fi Madhab al-Imam Malik (Part of Majmu' al-Rif'ah fi Ba'd Mutun Fiqh al-Madhahib al-Arba'ah)
publisher: Dar Ammar for Publishing and Distribution
text:
1001 - Section: The oath of Sharia is by Allah who... no Lord worshipped other than Him is emulated.
1002 - By Him equal are Disbeliever and Muslim... and disbelievers are made to swear by what they venerate.
1003 - In a quarter Dinar and higher it is aggravated... and bring out for it the female even if secluded.
1004 - And every claim, its condition is two just witnesses... and did not lead to wealth like: Ihsan (chastity/marriage status).
1005 - And slander and Hudud and clientage... and contract and Iddah and Ila'.
1006 - So no oath if stripped [of witnesses] and... the Ila' does not turn against the one who refused.
1007 - And every claim whose root is wealth... or leads to wealth like terms.
1008 - And Khul' and admission and Qirad... and inheritance and pre-emption and mutual consent.
1009 - With a man and two women, suffice... or one of the two types with him, so swear.
1010 - And everything specific to women... like menstruation and pregnancy: then two women.
1011 - And in adultery or sodomy, four... by seeing in a moment gathered.
1012 - Witnessing the private part in a private part he inserted... like seeing the stick inside the kohl container.

1016 - Or dragged a benefit or for harm he repelled... from himself or from a relative who is close.

1018 - Likewise the punished in what he was punished for... or a scholar performing against a peer.

Chapter on Crimes (Jinayat)

1023 - Or by: Qasamah (oaths) with two just witnesses upon... like his wounding if he lived until he ate.

1028 - And the accidental killer of a free man, binding upon him... with his Aqilah (male relatives): Diyah paid in installments.

1048 - Intent of the child is like accident in his wealth... what is less than a third or upon his Aqilah.

1049 - And they defined Apostasy: Disbelief of the Muslim... by inclusion of action or by understanding word.
1050 - From: A discerning Muslim by choice... like: his tying the belt (Zunnar) on his waist.

1056 - Will and purity and prayer... and fasting and Hajj likewise Zakat.

1078 - Or his killing or from opposite sides cut... and exile with imprisonment until he repents.
1079 - And accept him if he came repenting apologizing... and drop the rights of Allah not the right of people.
1080 - So from him no pardon if he killed... and by conspiracy kill the group for a person.

1081 - And valid is manumission of a slave sound... from every suspension and right, submitting.

1098 - For inheritance are causes: Clientage and Lineage... then Marriage, Treasury is brought.
1099 - And inheritance is prevented by: Description of Slavery... and Killing intentionally or by doubt of precedence.
1100 - Or lack of crying out [at birth] or Li'an... likewise Adultery, difference of religions.
1101 - And say: Full siblings are the twins of Li'an... and in adultery to the mother they are attributed.
1102 - And the heirs among men count them:... Son or son's son, father or grandfather.
1103 - And absolute brother and his son from other than the mother... and the uncle not of the mother and his son, so add.
1104 - And the husband and the freer and the residuary... by self, and women are ten counted:
1105 - Daughter and son's daughter and absolute sister... and wife, mother and grandmother, freer.
1106 - Then the shares: Half, quarter, eighth... two-thirds, third, then sixth, so mean.
1107 - So the Half: For the husband without a branch [child] and add:... A daughter like son's daughter and sister not of mother.
1108 - And the Quarter: For the husband with the branch of hers... and it is for her with his loss from her husband.
1109 - And the Eighth: For wives with him, I mean... by branch: The children and children of the son.
1110 - And the Two-Thirds: For the one who is multiple... of those who have the half when solitary.
1111 - And the Third: The share of his mother with loss of... what exceeded one brother and loss of children.
1112 - And it is: For a group of mother's sons [siblings] rising... from one, from branch or root void.
1113 - And the Sixth: For the father and mother if found... a branch like grandfather and son of mother solitary.
1114 - Like son's daughter with a single daughter... or father's sister with an extra full sister.
